data.name: clear_recent_caption
data.value: Clear the list of recent projects?

data.name: clear_recent_text
data.value: Are you sure you want to clear the list of recent projects? You cannot undo this operation.

data.name: closed_project_text
data.value: You are about to close a project with unsaved modifications. Do you want to save these modifications before closing the project?

data.name: save_settings_error_text
data.value: The following error occurred while trying to save the settings: "{0}" As a result, changes to the settings made during this session have not been saved. Oh well.

data.name: create_directory_text
data.value: The directory {0} does not exist. Do you want to create it?

data.name: no_device_found_text
data.value: Could not select an audio input and output device. Please check if DirectX 9c is properly installed.

data.name: no_output_device_text
data.value: Could not select an audio output device: none found.

data.name: no_input_device_text
data.value: Could not select an audio input device: none found.

data.name: saved_as_daisy_text
data.value: Exported project to DAISY in directory {0}

data.name: export_choose_folder
data.value: Please select the folder in which to save your DAISY book.

data.name: default_directory_browser
data.value: Please choose a default project directory below.

data.name: export_directory_browser
data.value: Please choose a default export directory below.

data.name: cannot_delete_text
data.value: The file {0} cannot be deleted. Press OK to continue or Cancel to abort. (Reason given: {1})

data.name: empty_directory_text
data.value: You are about to export your DAISY project to {0}. This directory is not empty (perhaps you exported a previous version of your project to that directory.) Do you want to empty this directory before exporting?

data.name: didnt_save_as_daisy_text
data.value: Could not export project to DAISY in directory {0}. Reason given: {1}

data.name: import_phrase_error_text
data.value: The audio file "{0}" could not be imported as its audio settings (channels, bit depth, sample rate) do not match those of the project.

data.name: dc_publisher_description
data.value: The agency responsible for making the DTB available.

data.name: dc_title_description
data.value: The title of the DTB, including any ssubtitles.

data.name: missing_description
data.value: The description for this metadata item is missing.

data.name: error_metadata_name_message
data.value: Cannot create metadata item with the name "{0}": name must not start with "dtb:"

data.name: really_use_directory_text
data.value: Directory "{0}"is not empty. If you want to empty this directory before using it, choose "Yes." If you want to use this directory as is, choose "No."

data.name: init_error_text
find_in_text_init
data.value: Type the text to search for it in the selected section.

data.name: no_preceding_silence_phrase
data.value: There was no silence phrase preceding the selection, so default values will be used. You can still modifiy these default settings freely, or cancel and select a silence phrase.

data.name: create_new_project_from_import
data.value: Create a new project from import

data.name: import_failed
data.value: Could not create project from import: {0}

data.name: clean_failed_text
data.value: Obi failed to clean the current project, apparently for the following reason: {0}

data.name: clean_up_ask_for_delete_project
data.value: The unused files are moved to the delete folder. Will you like to delete these unused files?

data.name: clean_save_text
data.value: Your project will be saved after cleaning. Do you want to continue?

data.name: about_file_name
data.comment: Location of the HTML document for the "About" dialog

data.name: propose_directory_text
data.value: The directory that you selected to save your new project is not empty. Would you prefer to select the following location for your new project: "{0}"?

data.name: audio_block_label
data.comment: Audio block label of the form "audio block n of m(, unused)"

data.name: dc_contributor_description
data.value: A party whose contribution to the publication is secondary to those named in dc:Creator.

data.name: dc_coverage_description
data.value: The extent or scope of the content of the resource. Not expected to be used for DTBs.

data.name: dc_creator_description
data.value: Names of primary author or creator of the intellectual content of the publication.

data.name: dc_date_description
data.value: Date of publication of the DTB. (Compare dtb:sourceDate and dtb:producedDate.) In format from [ISO8601]; the syntax is YYYY[-MM[-DD]] with a mandatory 4-digit year, an optional 2-digit month, and, if the month is present, an optional 2-digit day of month.

data.name: dc_description_description
data.value: Plain text describing the publication's content.

data.name: dc_format_description
data.value: The standard or specification to which the DTB was produced.

data.name: dc_identifier_description
data.value: A string or number identifying the DTB.

data.name: dc_language_description
data.value: Language of the content of the publication. An [RFC 3066] language code. For Sweden: "sv" or "sv-SE"; for UK: "en" or "en-GB"; for US: "en" or "en-US"; etc.

data.name: dc_relation_description
data.value: A reference to a related resource.

data.name: dc_rights_description
data.value: Information about rights held in and over the DTB. (Compare dtb:sourceRights.)

data.name: dc_source_description
data.value: A reference to a resource (e.g., a print original, ebook, etc.) from which the DTB is derived. Best practice is to use the ISBN when available.

data.name: dc_subject_description
data.value: The topic of the content of the publication.

data.name: dc_type_description
data.value: The nature of the content of the DTB (i.e., sound, text, image). Best practice is to draw from the Dublin Core's enumerated list [DC-Type].

data.name: dtb_audio_format_description
data.value: Total playing time of all SMIL files comprising the content of the DTB. Value is a Clock Value from SMIL 2.0 Timing and Synchronization Module

data.name: dtb_multimedia_content_description
data.value: Summary of the general types of media used in the content of this DTB. Value is a comma-delimited list of the top-level media types defined in [RFC2046]. In the current version of this standard, the only applicable types will be audio, text, and image. Media types that are referenced only by NCX, Resource File, or distInfo must not be listed here.

data.name: dtb_multimedia_type_description
data.value: One of the six types of DTB defined in the Structure Guidelines. Values are: audioOnly, audioNCX, audioPartText, audioFullText, textPartAudio, textNCX.

data.name: dtb_narrator_description
data.value: Name of the person whose recorded voice is embodied in the DTB.

data.name: dtb_produced_date_description
data.value: Date of first generation of the complete DTB, i.e. Production completion date. (Compare dc:Date.) In format from [ISO8601]; the syntax is YYYY[-MM[-DD]] with a mandatory 4-digit year, an optional 2-digit month, and, if the month is present, an optional 2-digit day of month.

data.name: dtb_producer_description
data.value: Name of the organization/production unit that created the DTB. (Compare dc:Publisher.)

data.name: dtb_revision_data_description
data.value: Date associated with the specific dtb:revision. In format from [ISO8601]; the syntax is YYYY[-MM[-DD]] with a mandatory 4-digit year, an optional 2-digit month, and, if the month is present, an optional 2-digit day of month.

data.name: dtb_revision_description
data.value: Non-negative integer value of the specific version of the DTB. Incremented each time the DTB is revised.

data.name: dtb_revision_description_description
data.value: A string describing the changes introduced in a specific dtb:revision.

data.name: dtb_source_date_description
data.value: Date of publication of the resource (e.g., a print original, ebook, etc.) from which the DTB is derived. In format from [ISO8601]; the syntax is YYYY[-MM[-DD]] with a mandatory 4-digit year, an optional 2-digit month, and, if the month is present, an optional 2-digit day of month.

data.name: dtb_source_edition_description
data.value: A string describing the edition of the resource (e.g., a print original, ebook, etc.) from which the DTB is derived.

data.name: dtb_source_publisher_description
data.value: The agency responsible for making available the resource (e.g., a print original, ebook, etc.) from which the DTB is derived. (Compare dc:Publisher.)

data.name: dtb_source_rights_description
data.value: The agency responsible for making available the resource (e.g., a print original, ebook, etc.) from which the DTB is derived. (Compare dc:Publisher.)

data.name: dtb_source_title_description
data.value: The title of the resource (e.g., a print original, ebook, etc.) from which the DTB is derived. To be used only if different from dc:Title.

data.name: dtb_total_time_description
data.value: Total playing time of all SMIL files comprising the content of the DTB. Value is a Clock Value from SMIL 2.0 Timing and Synchronization Module.

data.name: metadata_name_error_text
data.value: Cannot change the name of this metadata entry to "{0}".

data.name: phrase_to_string
data.comment: ToString(); e.g. [unused] phrase 3 of 5 (2.5s), page number 2

data.name: obi_url
data.comment: Obi URL (may point to localized page.)

data.name: max_phrase_duration_invalid_input
data.value: Invalid input for maximum phrase duration. Please specify an integral number of minutes higher than 0.

data.name: rendering_waveform
data.comment: Waveform display before bitmap is created

data.name: long_h_mm_ss
data.comment: Longer time formating (e.g. 1 hour 23 minutes 45 seconds)

data.value: Error adding page number: no parent section found.

data.name: no_headings_found

data.name: wrong_heading_order
data.value: Heading elements are in the wrong order.

data.name: duration_hh_mm_ss

data.name: project_locked
data.value: Project is locked, probably because either previous session of this project was terminated improperly or there is another session of Obi with the same project open. If you are sure that there are no other sessions of Obi you can try to remove the lock file "{0}", but proceed at your own risk.

data.name: path_not_rooted
data.value: Path "{0}" is not rooted. Please choose a complete path, including the drive letter.

data.name: delete_silence_phrases

data.name: Obi_UserInformationText
data.value: Please fill in the following form to register yourself as an user of obi (free/open source DAISY production tool). This registration will entitle you to receive latest news and product updates right in your mailbox. Moreover, you will be able to play a crucial role in providing the future direction to the product as it will allow us to understand your requirements in a better way. Please make sure that computer is connected to internet while registration. Existing users are requested to register again because this registration will be stored permanently for next versions of Obi also.

data.name: CleanUp_LongFilePath
data.value: The project directory has long file path which may lead to major problems in cleanup causing loss of important data. It is strongly recommended to move the project directory near to the partition before starting clean up. Do you want to continue inspite of the stated warning?

data.name: UserRegistration_SendEmailMsg
data.value: Unable to upload the users registration information in {0} attempts. Please send email to obi.feedback@gmail.com to register.

data.name: CheckUpdates_NewVersionNotAvailable
